desc: The BCL10 (B-cell CLL/lymphoma 10) gene encodes an adaptor protein involved in apoptosis and NFkB signaling. BCL10 was discovered at the breakpoint of a recurrent translocation in a subtype of low-grade malignant lymphomas, and subsequent experiments showed its role in apoptosis and NFkB regulation (PMID: 1728948, 9989495, 10319863). The BCL10 protein contains a caspase-recruitment domain (CARD) commonly found in proteins involved in apoptosis and inflammation pathways (PMID: 9989495). BCL10 forms part of the CARD11–BCL10–MALT1 (CBM) complex, which is a regulator of NFkB in lymphocytes following antigen stimulation (PMID: 25087226, 15541657). Mutations in BCL10 have been found at low frequency in lymphomas, germ cell tumors and the MSI-high type of colorectal cancer (PMID: 10819599, 10582682, 11445840).

articles/5/title: Point mutations and deletions of the Bcl10 gene in solid tumors and malignant lymphomas.

articles/7/title: Bcl10 expression, rearrangement and mutation in MALT lymphoma: correlation with expression of nuclear factor-kappaB.

desc: BCL10, a tumor suppressor and pro-apoptotic protein, is infrequently altered in cancer.
